column4: I have ushare installed, and it created a /etc/init.d/ushare. How do I configure this to run automatically at boot?
1) i have NO idea what ushare is 2) FYI /etc/init.d is the old sysv - ubuntu uses upstart.  good luck.

What ushare does is irrelevant, but it provides you with a name of a process. And upstart doesn't seem to play well with /etc/init.d/; you either have to convert from one to another or duplicate the effort. If you have upstart call the /etc/init.d/ file, it won't get the pid and be able to get status
sorry.  i'm zero help on upstart (services on ubuntu).
